column4: anyoen got a smart command line that can tell me how many megs have been downloaded through an ethernet interface in the last 10 seconds (almost like an iostat for a network card, so every 10 seconds it gives me a count on downloaded traffic)
I can't use iptraf to watch the pacekts in real time because the throughput is 2 fast and it kills the cpu
you'd need to monitor the data flow, then reort on the data collection. I dont believe ubuntu monitors that sort of data by default
I have low requirements, so I have old gear
